frameDefinitions: The Authorities hold a Suspect under suspicion of having committed a crime (Charges).
Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.'
An Agent begins preventing a Captive from moving despite a tendency or desire on the part of the Captive to do so.

A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.
An Experiencer is in an undesirable Situation, whose Explanation may also be expressed.
This frame describes the process that involves the inquiry and determination by an authority, the Investigator, of the circumstances surrounding an Incident perpetrated by a Suspect.
frameExamples: The police <t>held</t> Mr. Smith in the slammer on charges of killing his lawyer.
The police <t>arrested</t> Harry on charges of manslaughter.
Authorities recently <t>captured</t> several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
The fraud was <t>extradited</t> from Venezuela to the US.
The insurers ended up in the <t>bind</t> of having to pay 15 years' taxes.
The police are <t>investigating</t> the bank's reported loss of several thousand dollars from their downtown branch's top security vault. DNI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Authorities</fen> hold the <fen>Suspect</fen> in custody.
This role identifies the person who is taken into custody and held, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
When the detaining occurs.
Where the detaining takes place.
<fen>Charges</fen> identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is charged.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.
The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
<fen>Offense</fen> identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arrest occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arrest occurs.
The entity which is captured.
The <fen>Agent</fen> brings the <fen>Captive</fen> into custody.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the <fen>Captive</fen>.
When the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> act on behalf of the <fen>Current_jurisdiction</fen>, giving up the <fen>Suspect</fen> to the Crime_jurisdiction.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) the <fen>Suspect</fen> starts off in.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) to which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is sent.
The Suspect is forced to go to the jurisdiction where a crime he or she is suspected of took place or is being tried.
The time at which  the <fen>Suspect</fen> is moved.
The location where the extradition occurs.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in an undesirable <fen>Situation</fen>.
This role identifies the undesirable <fen>Situation</fen> the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in.
Thiis role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Situation</fen> is in effect.
The location where the <fen>Situation</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Investigator</fen> is the person or agency that investigates the <fen>Suspect</fen> of a crime (<fen>Incident</fen>).

The <fen>Investigator</fen> attempts to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the <fen>Incident</fen>, which is typically a criminal act (murder, robbery) or the result of such an act (death, loss of money).
This role denotes the <fen>Suspect</fen> that is investigated by the <fen>Investigator</fen>.
When the <fen>Investigator</fen> investigates the <fen>Incident</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The police arrested Harry <fex>on charges of manslaughter</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested <fex>Harry</fex> on charges of manslaughter.
They arrested Harry <fex>for shoplifting</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
Police have captured <fex>three of the suspected bombers</fex> after a week-long search.
<fex>Authorities</fex> recently captured several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
Authorities secured the target <fex>in a private residence</fex>.
<fex>French officials</fex> extradited him back to Canada.
Jones was extradited <fex>from Mexico</fex> last Thursday to face criminal charges in the United States.
It was the third time a neo-Nazi was extradited from Denmark <fex>to Germany</fex>.
A hearing on whether or not to extradite <fex>Johnson</fex> to Isreal will be held tomorrow.
<fex>In Europe</fex> they extradite more freely than in North America.
<fex>The insurers</fex> ended up in a bind.
They found themselves in a quite <fex>a fix</fex>.
<fex>Yesterday's</fex> predicament was a little too exciting.
The trouble <fex>in America</fex> is only going to get worse.
The police are investigating <fex>Dr. Phil</fex>.
Our guys are <fex>currently</fex> investigating her disappearance.
